intro: Justicia laevigata, commonly known as the velvetleaf or Mexican verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs, giving them a velvety texture. Its showy, tubular flowers are typically pink or red and bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. The plant is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as stream banks and roadsides.
